entries.title: Accounting for the Lines We Would Not Cross in Ukraine | Opinion
entries.description:
The United States is taking new steps—steps it once said it would not take—to help Ukraine in the fight against Russia. Ukraine gets the Patriot anti-missile system and Ukrainian soldiers get a free trip to Oklahoma to train in how to use it.
This is a necessary and inevitable step, but before we take the next one it's important to take into account how we got here—and how far we are willing to go.

entries.title: Robert Fratta Called Death Sentence 'Enlightening' Days Before Execution
entries.description: Robert Fratta was executed Tuesday night for his role in the 1994 murder of his estranged wife.

entries.title: Ukraine Mocks Russia as 'Masochists' in Battle for Salt-Mining Soledar
entries.description: The Ukrainian Ministry of Defense asked if Russia believes "that salt will heal the wounds of the maimed occupiers."

entries.title: Video Shows Man Breaking Into Taqueria Where Robber Was Killed Last Week
entries.description: This robber broke into the restaurant just five days after a robber was shot and killed by a customer, also caught on video.

entries.title: Zelensky Strips Putin Ally of Ukrainian Citizenship
entries.description: Viktor Medvedchuk, a longtime friend of Russian President Vladimir Putin, was at one time the leader of a pro-Russia party in Ukraine.
